title:
Correspondence between grey-body factors and quasinormal frequencies for
  rotating black holes
abstract:
Although the proper oscillation frequencies of black holes (quasinormal
modes) and the grey-body factors, which determine the scattering properties of
black holes, represent two distinct spectral problems with different boundary
conditions, a recent study has revealed an intrinsic connection between these
quantities. We have shown that the correspondence between grey-body factors and
quasinormal modes, previously established for spherically symmetric and
asymptotically flat black holes, also extends to general parametrized axially
symmetric black holes. This correspondence is limited to non-superradiant
waves.
